intro: Psychotria fernandezii, commonly known as the "angel's trumpet" or "crown of the Andes," is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep red. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Psychotria fernandezii is also known for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as scopolamine and hyoscyamine.
